pros: I think there is nothing good

pros: Diversity Ambassador Training. Oustanding program to train everyone senior leaders, faculty and staff on key diversity principles. This program "evangelized" trainees to go forward and create change. Very very well run and super engagement with select faculty and staff.
cons: Complete lack of integrity. Lies and cover-ups were the norm. People were routinely fired for having differing view points or arbitrary reasons that could not even be seen. This happened to straight white men, in addition to POC and women. If they had even an inkling that a person identified as gay they would be routed out with speed. It's sad because the foundational principles of the institution are admirable, but the leaders stole money, lied to students, faculty and staff and the wheels began falling off in 2017 with the departure of the University President. If this school is still enrolling students in 2025, it will likely be due to divine intervention.

review_title: Great place to work, little room to grow

review_title: A Great Place to Work For and to Grow in Faith.

job_title: Program Management Coordinator in Azusa, CA
pros: Tuition discount is all that remains.
cons:
Health benefits cost $250 per paycheck for HMO for a family of 3. They slashed retirement contribution from 8% to 3% matching. HR does not advocate for employees.  If you report abuse or mismanagement, nothing happens. 
 Mismanagement of funds has put the university near default.  They promote people into management who aren't performing well as a worker.  The environment is toxic, unfriendly.  No room for advancement.  No raises, and if there was, it was 2% or less.  Huge gap between faculty and staff.  Nursing and Education departments are the worse to work for.

pros: Nice people.  Great Christian environment--free from profanity, often prayer at the start of meetings.

Afterwards, I was not able to perform to the satisfaction of my department. I asked a couple of times about moving to a different position.  In the end, however, they terminated me without any severance pay or health insurance.
